questions.question: Balance the equation C2H5(OH)NH2COO + H2SO4 → (NH4)2SO4 + SO2 + 14 CO2 + H2O
Which one of the following inorganic forms of nitrogen predominates in the soil?

explanations.a: N2 is present but not in usable form.
explanations.b: Correct. Nitrate (NO3⁻) is the predominant usable inorganic form.
explanations.c: Nitrite (NO2) is less stable in soil.

questions.question: The process by which organic nitrogen is converted to nitrate through bacterial activity is known as?

explanations.b: Immobilization retains N in organic form.
explanations.c: Denitrification is the reduction of nitrate.
explanations.d: Correct. Nitrification converts NH4+ to NO3⁻.

questions.question: In which condition does denitrification occur?

explanations.a: Partially correct, but not necessary to be N-limited.
explanations.c: Correct. Denitrification occurs under low oxygen.
explanations.d: Nitrogen must be available to be reduced.

questions.question: The microbial transformation of organic nitrogen to inorganic forms is referred to as?

explanations.d: Correct. Mineralization includes all microbial conversion to inorganic forms.
